TopicTitle: Reduce wobble between stages and other stacked parts

Articles.Content:
I am having annoying troubles with my rockets wobbling too much when they really shouldn't wobble, it just seems like the connections between some stacked parts are way too elastic. At the moment I am using something like this to stop it but while it does look pretty in it's own way it doesn't look as pretty as a clean rocket and I'm sure there must be a better way of doing this.

Help?

You can strut between stages directly in most circumstances, no need for the extra scaffolding. Start a strut on one part and extend it directly vertically. Works most of the time for me. Another technique is to avoid maximum throttle. Most of my heavy launches use half throttle at most. Seems to reduce the wobble quite a bit.
Trying to vertically strut never works for me, that's why I used the cubic struts.
You can also reduce the number of gimballing engines (or turn gimballing off with an action group).
